intro: Palala theiodora, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, branching stems covered in fine, hairy foliage. Its most distinctive feature is its clusters of small, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. Palala theiodora is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
